revised_title: Discovery and Preservation of Ancient Writings from Herculaneum
tldr: A letter from a learned gentleman in Naples describes the discovery of a large number of ancient rolls made of papyrus, found in a villa near the site of the ancient city of Herculaneum. Despite the damage caused by time and fire, efforts are being made to unroll and read these rolls, with some success. The process is slow and painstaking, but the rolls are believed to contain works of ancient Greek literature, including philosophical tracts and music theory.
